meta.topic_title: How infrastructure as code deploys entire systems with one command

content.post:
Stop managing servers manually. With Infrastructure as Code (IaC), you can deploy entire systems from a single command. Repeatable, consistent, fast. 🚀

https://t.ly/iac1
alt_versions:
Treat your infrastructure like software. IaC enables deploying complex systems with one command. Learn to build consistent and auditable environments. ⚙️

https://t.ly/iac1

How does Infrastructure as Code work? Understand declarative vs. imperative approaches and deploy systems reliably with version-controlled configs. 🧠

https://t.ly/iac1
content.extended_post:
Infrastructure as Code (IaC) is a mindset shift. It falls into two main approaches:

🔹 **Declarative (The "What"):** You define the desired end state (e.g., "I need 5 servers with this config"), and the IaC tool figures out how to achieve it. Think Terraform or CloudFormation.

🔸 **Imperative (The "How"):** You write explicit, step-by-step commands to reach the end state. Think shell scripts or Ansible.

By using version control (like Git), every change is tracked, reviewed, and auditable.
